thread.title: June Oscar named new Social Justice Commissioner
thread.title_full: June Oscar named new Social Justice Commissioner

author: Dan Conifer
title: June Oscar named new Social Justice Commissioner
text:
By political reporter Dan Conifer Posted February 09, 2017 15:37:40 Map: Australia 
Indigenous leader June Oscar has been named the new Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Social Justice Commissioner. 
The Bunuba woman will replace Mick Gooda, who is now a Commissioner investigating the Northern Territory's youth justice system . 
"I have known Ms Oscar for many years and have admired her passionate advocacy for Indigenous Australians," Indigenous Affairs Minister Nigel Scullion said. 
"Ms Oscar's appointment demonstrates the central role Indigenous women play in bringing about social change and I look forward to working closely with her in the future." 
Ms Oscar has been instrumental in fighting alcohol-related damage in Indigenous communities . 
She successfully campaigned to reduce full-strength alcohol sales in the Fitzroy Valley region of Western Australia in 2007. 
She also helped initiate Australia's first study into Foetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder. 
"Ms Oscar will bring deep knowledge and experience in dealing with the problem of alcohol abuse in Indigenous communities, and strategies to mitigate the effect of that abuse on women and children in particular," Attorney-General George Brandis said. 
"Ms Oscar has an outstanding record as a determined, courageous and pragmatic advocate for the rights of Indigenous Australians." 
Ms Oscar is currently chief executive of the Marninwarntikura Women's Resource Centre in Fitzroy Crossing. 
The incoming commissioner has previously been on boards of the Lowitja Institute, the Australian Institute for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Commission. 
She will begin in April.
